alert.note: Alert for Jefferson (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 04 at 9:48PM CDT until August 07 at 11:07AM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Missouri... Big River at Byrnesville. River forecasts are based on observed precipitation and forecast precipitation for the next 24 hours. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Big River at Byrnesville. * WHEN...Until late Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 19.3 feet, South Byrnesville Road goes under water near this level. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 PM CDT Friday the stage was 18.0 feet. - Bankfull stage is 16.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:45 PM CDT Friday was 18.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 19.5 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecasts (7:00 am) Location Stg Stage Sun Mon Tue Wed Thu Big River Byrnesville 16.0 18.0 17.1 10.3 7.3 6.3 5.9 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Rainfall heavier than forecast could cause river levels to rise even higher than predicted. The National Weather Service will monitor this developing situation and issue follow up statements as conditions change. This product, along with additional weather and stream information, is available at https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=lsx.
